Enslaved Amount: §Y[province_slaves_production.GetValue]§! (20% of province total population)\nThis province is regularily raided by slavers, its unlucky population abducted.\n(Note that fractions of the above variable are ignored by gameplay.)
This province could become a primary origin of freshly caught slaves, if a nearby hunt yields slaves.

Slave Trade: §Y[province_slaves_traded_away.GetValue]§!/§Y[province_slaves_brought_to.GetValue]§!\nNearby slave raids have yielded slaves that are brought to this province, to be from here on traded further away.

Slave Trade: §Y[province_slaves_traded_away.GetValue]§!/§Y[province_slaves_traded_to.GetValue]§!\nThis province is a hub of the slave trade: Though slaves might not be caught in its direct vicinity, they are brought from far away to this place, to be traded away even further.

Slave Pops: §Y[province_population_slaves.GetValue]§!\nSlaves are brought to work in this province. They need little supply and can greatly help with building construction, but beware their wrath if they might revolt...
